snippet: The New Mexico company, Valley Meat, drew complaints over a two-year period from federal inspectors and state regulators over its disposal of remains when it processed cattle for beef.
abstract: Valley Meat, New Mexico company trying to become first slaughterhouse for horses in the United States since 2007, drew complaints over a two-year period from federal inspectors and state regulators over its disposal of remains when it processed cattle for beef; complaints raise questions about whether Agriculture Dept will approve firm's application.
lead_paragraph: The New Mexico company, Valley Meat, drew complaints over a two-year period from federal inspectors and state regulators over its disposal of remains when it processed cattle for beef.

headline.seo: Horse Meat Processing Applicant’s Food Safety Is Questioned
headline.main: Horse Meat Applicant’s Food Safety Is Questioned
headline.print_headline: Horse Meat Applicant’s Food Safety Is Questioned
